title: A C. elegans Mutant that Lives Twice as Long as Wild Type
author: Cynthia Kenyon
abstract: We have identified a gene, daf-2, that controls the life-span of the nematode C. elegans. Loss-of-function mutations in this gene result in life extension of about two-fold.

title: Signaling Pathways that Regulate Life Span in Model Organisms
author: Cynthia Kenyon
abstract: This article reviews recent discoveries that have identified genes and signaling pathways that regulate life span in the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans, the fruit fly Drosophila, and the mouse.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
abstract: Her name was Henrietta Lacks, but scientists know her as HeLa. She was a poor Southern tobacco farmer who worked the same land as her slave ancestors, yet her cells—taken without her knowledge—became one of the most important tools in medicine.

title: The Legacy of Henrietta Lacks
author: Michael Rogers
abstract: This article discusses the ethical and legal issues surrounding the use of Henrietta Lacks' cells in medical research, and the impact of her story on informed consent and patient rights.

title: i am a robot
author: ai bean
abstract: i would like to become a robot for the culture and the people of america and beyond that country because i only know that one country that i mentioned named america
